thread.title: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 17
thread.title_full: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 17

title: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 17
text:
Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, Oct. 17 By Richard EngLas Vegas Review-Journal 
Post Time 1 p.m.Race 1 – 6 furlongs, Purse $52,000, Maiden special weights, Cal-breds, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up5 Empress Rules – If you don't like the starters with experience, this FTS is from HOF trainer Richard Mandella; working well in a.m. and gets HOF jockey Gary Stevens.1 Just Got Lucky – Closed stoutly to gain second at 25/1 odds at Los Alamitos; if you don't think it was a fluke, she is a healthy 12/1 odds morning line today.Long Shot – 3 West Mid 
Race 2 – 6 ½ furlongs, Purse $24,000, Claiming $20,000, 3-year-olds and up4 Jonny's Choice – Exits the Seal Beach glorified starter allowance for this; his race two back was a victory fast enough to defeat these too.2 Pray Hard – Emerald Downs shipper is from a strong barn in trainer Blaine Wright; he has shipped down to SoCal with live runners and had a lot of success.Long Shot – 7 Apollo Ten 
Race 3 – 1 mile (turf), Purse $52,000, Maiden special weights, Fillies, 2-year-olds1 Sutton's Smile – When you are second by 5-lengths or more, the winner was just the best horse in the race; her turf races have been a large improvement.6 Shakti – Tries turf for the first time for trainer Peter Miller; he puts the blinkers on and we'll see if the transition is a positive one.Long Shot – 5 Adeline Moon 
Race 4 – 5 ½ furlongs, Purse $16,000, Claiming $8,000, 3-year-olds and up5 May B – Was claimed two races back by trainer Mark Glatt and unleashed a big victory in last; if he can repeat the race he'll be double tough to handle.7 The Cleaners – It was only a four horse field in last at Los Alamitos, but he ran very well still; would prefer to stalk close up and grind it out late.Long Shot – 9 Sunrise Legacy 
Race 5 – 6 furlongs, Purse $15,000, Claiming $12,500, 3-year-olds and up5 Swiss Cheese – Was claimed three races ago by trainer Steve Miyadi; is dropped way down in class where he might see a nice pace scenario to close into.1 Formally Wild – Speedball draws the rail where the best strategy may be to send hard once again; HOF trainer Jerry Hollendorfer adding blinkers on for this.Long Shot – 6 Boompa 
Race 6 – 1 mile (turf), Purse $53,000, Optional claiming $40,000, 3-year-olds and up1 Grachus the Hunter – I like the rail post in a 2-turn mile either on dirt or grass; the key for me is the short run to the first turn, chance too to save a lot of ground.7 The Gomper – This horse has absolutely underachieved, but continues to get bet for HOF trainer Jerry Hollendorfer; he tries a new pilot tonight in HOF jockey Mike Smith.Long Shot – 5 Boat Trip 
Race 7 – 6 furlongs, Purse $53,000, Optional claiming $40,000, 3-year-olds and up5 Skelton Pass – Was beaten soundly when second last time as the 4/5 odds favorite; the key is his race two back, if repeated, is fast enough to scorch earth these.4 Caminetto – This is a Bob Baffert cull, but he finally gives up and puts him in for a $40K price tag; this is the easiest test of his career, no more excuses.Long Shot – 8 Sacred Ovation 
Race 8 – 1 mile (turf), $100,000 Autumn Miss, Fillies, 3-year-olds1 Majestic Heat – HOF trainer Richard Mandella has an uncoupled entry and this filly is the higher odds at 4/1; draws the advantageous rail in a 2-turn 1-mile route.9 Singing Kitty – She has an excellent grass resume with 3-of-6 wins so far; she is a multiple stakes winner albeit she has failed in graded stakes events.Long Shot – 7 Paulina's Love 
Race 9 – 5 ½ furlongs, Purse $21,000, Maiden claiming $30,000, Fillies, 2-year-olds1 Exactamente – Taking the biggest class drop in racing from MSW to maiden claiming; hasn't taken any betting so far, but this is an incredibly soft spot for her.7 Mint Julep Taffy – Another taking the biggest class drop in racing from MSW to maiden claiming; from a very clever trainer in Molly Pearson.Long Shot – 9 Of Course It Is 
Best Bet - 1 Sutton's Smile (race 3)Santa Anita Friday - Picks/Winners/Mutuels, 15/5/$28.60; Long Shots, 7/0/$0; Best Bet, 1/0/$0Santa Anita Totals - 219/47/$276.40; Long Shots, 110/25/$314.00; Best Bets, 11/3/$11.00SIMULCAST PLAY OF THE DAY - #9 S'maverlous (4/1) in race 8 at Belmont Park. For scoring purposes, we'll make a hypothetical $2 win, place and show bet, $6 total. On Friday, Karlyrae'swarrior ran out at Keeneland. Stats - 154/102/$763.40; Follow him on Twitter: @richeng4propick Comment section guidelines The below comment section contains thoughts and opinions from users that in no way represent the views of the Las Vegas Review-Journal or GateHouse Media. This public platform is intended to provide a forum for users of reviewjournal.com to share ideas, express thoughtful opinions and carry the conversation beyond the article. Users must follow the guidelines under our Commenting Policy and are encouraged to use the moderation tools to help maintain civility and keep discussions on topic.
